Good price for a big clean room with big flat screen TV, big bath room, closet with in-safe (can hold a laptop), coffee maker (with Wolf Gang Puck coffee, pretty good) and free parking. Inside of room/bathroom seemed more updated than the exterior of the place. Only I wish there were mini-fridge, but ice bucket was provided and ice machine was on the every floor. Location is great, 10 minutes leisure walk to Fisherman’s wharf, lots of restaurant in little Italy (which is also 10-15 min walk). Trader Joes, Safeway, drugstore and Star Bucks are 4-5 blocks away on Bay street. Buses run in front of the hotel and 2 blocks away, there is a first stop for cable car. Overall, we were happy with our stay and would be back next time we visit SFO.

Reviews.Title: “consistently good, now with Trader Joe's around the corner”
Reviews.Author: goldenfleese
Reviews.Content: We have a 20 year history staying at the Columbus Inn. It remains a great choice. On this occasion we discovered yet another reason to stay there---a Trader Joe's is now just 3 blocks away at Bay St. and Mason. We bought brie, pate, bread and wine for the room, and even picked up sandwich wraps to take to the airport for the trip home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and a great price!”
Reviews.Author: maretx01
Reviews.Content: This motor inn is located about 3 city blocks from Fisherman's Warf and about 5 blocks from the Embarcadero. You are in North Beach and walking distance from China Town and all city transportation. The hotel itself is small and clean. It is old and not updated, but the beds were still good and the room was well cleaned daily. My only complaint would be the bathroom space being a bit small for our family. There was a great, large, flat screen (not that we were there very often)! The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful with recommendations and directions. There is free parking here, which is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected .... great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: PeteW60
Reviews.Content: Had 3 nights in San Fran as a part of a larger road trip with a rental car so we were looking for a good value, comfortable hotel in a great location with undercover parking. A bit of research on Trip Advisor suggestged that Columbus Motor Inn would fit the bill and it did so perfectly. It is not the fanciest place we stayed in during the trip but the room was large, clean and warm. It is well positioned to walk to entertainment on Fishermans' Wharf. Cable car stop is a short stroll and MUNI bus stops right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sarahtham
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in terms of the distance to tourist spots around. Fisherman's Wharf is only 15 minutes walk away. So its Pier 33 where you would take the Alcatraz tour. Municipal Bus service is half a block away. The rooms are large, really! Clean but deco a little outdated but I am not complaining. Flat screen TV, clean bathrooms. Ur usual coffee making facilities and room safe. Noise level was not bad. Nothing untoward happened but maybe the location of the room may answer that. I had 309 and it was lovely. Again, I cna t say how much I appreciated the space of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place from every angle”
Reviews.Author: gfroch
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location and free parking. Because of the price we didn't expect much. What a surprise! It was clean, great location, wonderful staff. The room wasn't huge, but not small either, fine for the four of us. Not a big lobby, but who hangs out in the lobby! It was far beyond our expectations. We happened by their sister property, I think it was called the Lombard, and they welcomed us like family. Offered us free parking in their lot, gave us directions to some good restaurant choices. I recommend this hotel or Lombard to anyone, especially with a car and/or family.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel, second stay and not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JR_in_NYC
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at Columbus Motor Inn with my wife on Jan 31st. This is our second time at this hotel. We were only going to be in San Francisco for one night, so we decided to re-book at this hotel as we had a pleasant experience the first time 3 years ago. We really like this hotel. It's very affordable, close to Fisherman's Wharf and the SF Cable Car terminal of the Powell-Mason line. The great thing about this hotel is the free parking, free wifi/wired internet and overall affordability. We spent 1 night for under $100. The hotel has been renovated from the last time we were here. The room has a flat screen TV, and they have made some minor changes, like replacing carpet, shower/bathtub. We were in room 303 which has a balcony facing Columbus Avenue. If you're not used to city living, I would recommend that you request a non Avenue facing street, as you can hear the traffic on the Avenue. The room has a safe where you can fit a 15" laptop. There was no desk area, but there is a table with two chairs near the balcony. The room is pretty big. Overall a good stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: thangstadt
Reviews.Content: After driving from another state to see our Son - his ship was porting in San Francisco - we were tired. We were woke by noise in rooms above us but the front desk did nothing. Finally an object hit our window and knocked the screen off - two separate rooms were throwing objects at the other windows. After yelling to stop I was threatened when they came to my door. Again the front desk considered this a normal night. After all of that at the time of checkout I was charged $40 more than quoted. This was the Worst Hotel Stay Ever!

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beaten for location and value”
Reviews.Author: Lu_and_Pete
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Columbus Motor Inn, which we booked after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were very impressed with the property, and would highly recommend it as a base for exploring SF. Free parking is available under the building, which was very convenient. The property initially looked a little worn and dated, but our room itself was modern, well appointed and very clean. It was also surprisingly spacious. We requested a room on a high floor away from the road, and both of these requests were met. The room was very quiet as a result of this, and we were able to enjoy great sleeps. The location is excellent, particularly consider the very low cost of our room, and we left the car behind most of the time and easily walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “A few blocks from Little Italy and the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: RamboSacto
Reviews.Content: Good size room on the Columbus Ave side. King size bed, table with 2 wooden chairs, coffee maker, WiFi, wall mounted flat screen w/ cable and a safe. This was a clean place. Maybe a little noisy being on the Columbus Ave but easily livable. What I liked about this place is the location, location, location. We walked to North Beach (Little Italy) and the Wharf. The cable car stop is just a couple of blocks away if you want to do that. Another plus is parking is included. What a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: travelin2014
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this choice of motel, as recommended by TripAdsvisor. Very clean and very reasonable for the location. Good for families. Access to everything. First time staying in the city,,,,,everything that I really wanted to see (Fishermans Wharf, North Beach, China Town) all in walking distance. I left my new jacket in the closet. I did not notice till stopped in another hotel several hours south of SF. I called the motel and they found the jacket. They shipped it back to me right away,,,of course I paid for it due to the fact that they had my credit card number. Still, they promptly shipped it back. I really appreciated that,,,they could have said, "not responsible for lost or stolen items."

Reviews.Title: “good value for price”
Reviews.Author: luckymaaa
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel close to the pier and public traffic as we only stayed one night in SFO. Hotel has bus station in front and trolley is also only 5Min walk away. Rooms are quite old fashioned but clean, bed comfy. Room was very big as i reserved a 2bed queen. No problem to leave the bags stored if flight leaves late.

Reviews.Title: “all good except the 6am street cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Craxiter
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews here and the price, I stayed here while attending a conference at the Moscone Center. A room facing the street was quite big and comfortable for two people sharing (two 'double' beds which were quite large). Street noise in the evening was a bit annoying but calmed considerably overnight so not too bad. However there is a noisy street cleaning every day around 6 am. If you are a light sleeper maybe a back room would be better. Other than that, good. Transportation options are good, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, frequent #30 Muni buses out the front door, and the Mason-Powell cable car about a block away. IF you have a car, which really is not a good idea in SF, you can park it and take transit, as others have mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Road_Warriors2000
Reviews.Content: Looks suspect in the picture, but it's a great hotel to stay. Our room was large, clean and comfortable. The hotel is in walking distance to wharf, trolley to downtown and great shopping and various locations throughout the city. We left the car in the hotel parking lot (for free) and took public transportation everywhere. The hotel price was fantastic for an expensive city. We definitely will stay here again when we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “All around perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: ukmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the two room suites with our kids. With what I thought was a good price for the space we were getting, I was afraid the beds would be old and lumpy but they were comfy with nice linens. Each room had a flat screen tv. The bathroom was fine (not huge but clean and adequate). The hotel is within walking distance of everything. Trader Joes, Safeway, and Walgreens are within a couple of blocks. Loads of great restaurants are all around. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown (with three kids and a stroller). Really a perfect option for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay; great value, location, staff, clean comfortable attractive room.”
Reviews.Author: JeanTCalif_
Reviews.Content: Located where Fisherman's Wharf blends into North Beach, so there are lots of restaurants in walking distance. #30 bus goes right by & travels down Stockton one block from Grant (Chinatown) and right by Union Square. Mason cable car start is 1 1/2 blocks away. FREE parking (unheard of this close in). Very quiet in rooms facing rear. No spa, exercise room, or luxurious lobby, etc. but who needs it with so much to do in SF. The staff is super friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accomodations a few blocks from the wharf.”
Reviews.Author: KSchm26136
Reviews.Content: If you're willing to walk a few blocks to the wharf, it's well worth staying here. It's very convenient to many great restaurants. The room was very big, and the bed was great. It's an older motel, but kept clean. They have free parking on site which is a big plus. Management was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for a "home base" in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: BruinsFan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights mid-October 2010 - mostly due to the reviews here. Price was also a big thing for us. I tend to over do it when it comes to reading and research on things and my trip to San Fran was no exception. I was afraid, with the cost of other hotels vs this one, that the Columbus would turn out to be a bad idea -- it was not, it was PERFECT. Great location, very comfy bed, flat screen TV with cable, quick hot water and in room coffee maker. There is no pool, no gym, no room service or 'continental breakfast' - but I hardly use any of that when I travel anyway. And, really, are powdered eggs so great? What is has is FREE PARKING and free WIFI!!!!!! What it IS is in a GREAT LOCATION, we walked to the Alcatraz Ferry, to Mama's (but didn't eat there because of the line!) and to the rest of Fisherman's Wharf as well. The folks at the front desk were very helpful when it came to pointing us in the right direction as well, since we had never been in SF this was great. It's not "right" on top of Fisherman's Wharf, it's about 4 blocks away I think, but for us walking is not a big deal and we WALKED everywhere in the city anyway, much easier than taking the rental and finding parking. Even if we were going to drive around, it's still in a great spot. Get a map at the office if you don't have one. So, if you're looking for the $450 night 'luxury' experience this is not for you. But, if what you are looking for is a base of operations in the city while you site see, etc., then this is it. We were on the 2nd floor and didn't have any issues w/noise on the street even though we were right on the street side. I would definitely stay here again. Also, there is a bar right across the street which was great for a night cap before going "home" to crash :-)

Reviews.Title: “You found a great place to stay trust trip advisior I did”
Reviews.Author: justtravelng
Reviews.Content: A hidden jewel. It is about 4 easy blocks to most places to see, Fisherman wharf,Chinatown, cable cars,resturants. Around the corner is a restrueant called Pat's Place. It is great for breakfast and lunch. The rooms are cleanwith new decor. Front desk was extremely helpful with all the tourist questions. This was my first time in SanFransciso and I throughly loved it. The hop on hop off was a good deal. Muir woods is a nice get away. If you are looking for a room with a view this isn't it. But a great value close to the action you found it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: MsBurry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a two night stay at the Columbus Motor Inn. We were very pleased with the accomodations. Very clean spacious room. We were on the 3rd floor facing the street with a balcony. The traffic noise was quieter at night and did not disturb us at all. Very comfortable bed. Free parking in the garage is great. We never got in the car. I have arthritic knees but was able to walk to Pier 33 for the Alcatraz cruise. We also walked to Club Fugazi on Green street to see Beach Blanket Babylon. We felt safe walking even at night. Great place to stay, centrally located to many restaurants and sights. The cable cars are right around the corner. Can't wait to come back to Columbus Motor Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: NickKaren
Reviews.Content: We were travelling up west coast and arrived in s.f. when the nike ladies marathon was on, which we did not realise. Made it impossible to get a hotel room. Eventually we arrived at Columbus Inn which had a free room for the night. Hotel was cheaper than others we had tried on the shore but very basic. Think we paid approx $170 for the night and do not think that this really represented value for money, although there was free parking which was good as it always annoys me when US hotels have an additonal charge to use their car park. Room was ok - had the feel that the cleanliness of the hotel was not great but did not actually have any issues. This was maybe more due to the impression the hotel gives by fact that it is quite run down. Hotel is in dire need of a coat of paint!!! Was glad that we were able to get a room here as nowhere else was available but that probably says something in itself. Probably ok if all you need for a night is a bed but thought that this hotel was very overpriced even for that. Will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Blackwater165
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn for three nights in Septemer 2010 after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Everything about the motel was good - location was perfect, walking distance to everything, the room was large, comfortable and quiet and it was great value for money. Free parking was a bonus, we left our car for the entire stay and walked/caught cable cars everywhere we went. The only negative was the difficulty in booking. We are from Australia and the motel's website did not offer secure credit card facilities. There was also no email contact available on the site. I ended up calling in the middle of the night our time but the person who answered found my accent difficult to understand so they provided me with an email address. A better website with secure credit card facilities and email contact details would be a positive addition. In short I would stay here again as it was clean, comfortable and conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SMartin1773
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columb1us Motor Inn in August for four nights and it was very clean and spacious. We had the 1 bedroom suite that included 3 beds, two TV's and plenty of square footage. The rooms were newly renovated and the staff was very friendly and helpful. It was located within walking distance of most of the attractions we wanted to visit. We had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Great little secret”
Reviews.Author: Firefighter4
Reviews.Content: I happened upon this place simply because there was just about nothing left because of the Oracle convention same dates we were there. Super clean, super nice people, walking distance to everything, NO BED BUGS, very quiet, very comfortable and the price was better than anything I found. No it is not the Ritz or the Hilton but I would send my kids or parents there without hesitation. I will stay there whenever i am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mattand34
Reviews.Content: This was a personal trip so I was watching my money for a change. This place was recommended by a local. The location was perfect and the parking was convenient. Clean rooms, good bed, pleasant staff. For the money I was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: NWfan
Reviews.Content: We visited San Francisco for 3 days this September and loved this hotel. It has free parking,(which is hard to find) and free internet. The room was quiet and clean with no surprises. Easy walk to Warf ,Ghirardelli Square,and Chinatown. We even walked to AT&T Park to see the Giants play the Dodgers.(about 3 miles).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Free Parking, Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: imisspinky
Reviews.Content: Columbus Motor Inn really has everything you need - walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Little Italy, Chinatown, Lombard Street, and Ghirardelli Sq. It was clean and comfortable and our view from the third floor was great. If I stayed here again I would ask for a third floor room. There is street noise, so the higher up the better. We stayed in room 301, the only 3rd floor room without a balcony, but it was fine because I think it is roomier than the rooms that have balconies, and it is a corner room so you get views of two sides of the city. The only negatives I would comment about is there is street noise so bring a pair of earplugs, and the parking is a little tight - but it's free.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! Loud traffic noises and sleepless nights ahead at the Columbus Motor Inn!”
Reviews.Author: emalekween
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the accolades on TripAdvisor about the good value, location and parking benefit of staying at The Columbus Motor Inn, my husband and I booked a two nights there. I had requested (per a previous poster's advice) a room at the back as we are both light sleepers. When we arrived, the staff was friendly but advised they could not honor our request for the back room. So, we thought since the hotel was so well-liked maybe we could manage in another room. Upon entering the room, my husband walked to the window, we drew the curtains and waited to see how loud the traffic noise might be. Well, it was so loud, we could imagine ourselves standing outside in the middle of the street with cars whizzing by. No double-paned glass here! So, we trucked back downstairs with luggage to see if we could possibly make some other arrangement or get a recommendation for another place to stay. The clerk simply answered 'no' and 'no'. He said he couldn't guarantee another room when we returned the following week and that he couldn't make any recommendation for another hotel. The rooms seemed adequate. We weren't looking for a Taj Mahal experience, but I was really thrown by the unhelpful attitude of the guy at the desk. All turned out well. We drove down the street to the Hilton and they gave us a suite for $199. for the night. Considerably more, but we were grateful we didn't have to spend a sleepless night.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Car0linaGrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early September and booked a room on the third floor with two double beds. The room was larger than I expected and had a nice sitting area with a table next to large windows looking out over Colombus Avenue. The weather was warm so we had the windows open and it was a bit noisy--didn't bother us but if you prefer quiet ask for a room off of the street. We asked for a refrigerator ($5 a night) and picked up snacks at Trader Joe's and Safeway a couple blocks away. Best of all, the staff were without fail cheerful and accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “The ratings say it all!”
Reviews.Author: swholidaymaker
Reviews.Content: Great motel with a spacious room for our family of four. We were initially disappointed that the family suite was already booked but it didn't matter in the end as our 2 beds room was just perfect! Night times were quiet and we slept well. Good position - walked to North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars etc. Free parking!! Breakfast at Pat's Cafe was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Best family hotel deal in SF by far.”
Reviews.Author: WestcoastMom
Reviews.Content: Having been to SF previously and seeing the location of this hotel and then checking all TA reviews, I went ahead and booked their family suite for our extended family of five. It is by far the best deal if you want to stay near Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel is less 2 blocks to cable cars, 4 short blocks to FW. We paid $210 in peak season for the family suite with two queen beds in main living area, and separate bedroom with another queen bed and plenty of room for the rollaway bed we requested. Room was spacious, updated with flat screen tvs in both sleeping areas, coffeemaker, windows that open, balcony off the bedroom and a great view of Alcatraz. Free parking and free wifi. In fact, last year I stayed at the Best Western Tuscan Inn at FW and this room was much nicer and more updated. If you need room for more than 4 people, look no farther and book the family suite here.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: kellox
Reviews.Content: First, the location is great--just a couple blocks from the wharf and the fantastic North Beach neighborhood. Cable car or bus downtown is easy. But the folks at this Inn are really the best part. I had trouble with the internet in my room and everyone there bent over backwards to help me get service. Oscar, the night guy, is a wonderful fellow who really wants to help people. The rooms are very nice and quiet and the parking is free--a major advantage. We'll stay there again, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, convenient!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTraveler014
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn twice during our recent trip to California. The first night we arrived in SF we stayed in a 3rd floor room and asked for a "quiet room." It was quiet alright. Looked out on an alley but believe me the silence was bliss after a flight from the East Coast and then a jam-packed afternoon exploring San Francisco. We then headed to Point Reyes and came back to the city on Saturday to meet up with friends. This time we had another 3rd floor room with a view. We worried because the nightclub next door (Bimbo's) was open and playing music that was reverberating but we fell asleep quickly after a busy day showing our friends around SF. After that we found out that Bimbo's is only open on a sporadic basis so no more noise. The view was wonderful--Coit Tower, TransAmerica building, and on and on. The free parking was a definite plus as others have stated. In fact I had considered a Westin (I think it was) where the rates were comparable but then noted that the parking fees were $50 per night! Plus rolling out of the hotel into North Beach was fantastic as this is one of the nicer sections of San Francisco. Many mentioned Mama's and Pat's for breakfast and I'm sure they're good but why not try some of the local cafes near Washington Square? Cafe Grecco comes to mind and there is a local chain called "La Boulange" which has wonderful granola and yoghurt, oatmeal, egg dishes, and of course pastries. We tried different ones every day and had fabulous coffee, pastries, egg dishes, you name it all good! We didn't use the transportation system much (have in the past and it is fantastic) but since it was just my husband, myself, my friend, and her son's 20 something girlfriend we walked easily to China Town. Fisherman's Wharf is rarely a place we go anymore but since this was my friend's first visit we walked down there and it was literally 3 blocks down Columbus. My husband and I also booked a tour called "Taste of the City" that was fabulous. We visited the fortune cookie factory in China Town, a tea-tasting shop, they were booked solid (the tour company) and therefore couldn't get us into the dim sum places so they got a local restaurant (Louis') to open up and they served us three large bowls filled with chow mein, sweet and sour pork, and fried rice--excellent. Thd gentleman with the restaurant served us some tea he grew on a mountainside in China! Our guide stayed with us long after the tour was supposed to be over and we had pizza in North Beach (Cinecetta I think) and enjoyed conversing with a group from Sweden and a young woman from Germany. As to the rooms: big room, flat screen tvs, in-room safe, bathroom and sink separated which makes it easier to get ready in the a.m., spotlessly clean, but I agree with an earlier reviewer that it would be nice if they had more pillows, ours seemed to be mini-sized! The people at the desk were so nice and always had a comment or a pleasant word for us. So all in all we had a wonderful time and would strongly recommend the Columbus.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have had better”
Reviews.Author: tpicone
Reviews.Content: We had a king-bed room on the second floor, facing Columbus ave. It was fantastic, slept like a baby. Yes, the bathroom setup is slightly dated but we couldn't have asked for more! The location was brilliant, we loved sitting on the little deck area in the morning with coffee, and we'll be back here again. Our friends paid more to be in Union Square, and then had to bus or cab to and from the wharf each day!

Reviews.Title: “Good Motel and location”
Reviews.Author: habs1087
Reviews.Content: Good no frills motel located within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Had an issue with the bathroom that was looked after quickly. Noah at the front desk was extremely helpful with sightseeing and getting around. Rooms look a little dated but were clean. Free parking was fanastic considering S.F hotels rates.Had a room on the third floor, Columbus Street side and it was very quiet at night. Could use more pillows on bed. If you want a good, inexpensive place to stay before startiing your sightseeing, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free parking!”
Reviews.Author: Buthker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Booked 2 rooms with each 2 double beds, so had enough space for the 4 of us. Location is great! Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Muni Bus stop in front of hotel which brings you to Union Square etc, at low cost. Recommend Pat's Café (Taylorstreet, 1 min. walk) for breakfast and dinner, really great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, free parking”
Reviews.Author: ginacope
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The major draw were the positive reviews re: cleanliness and the free parking since we had a rental car. The staff were extremely polite and helpful, room was ready prior to checkout time and very large. Bathroom is old but room is clean. Flat screen TV which we didn't have at 2 chains we stayed in later during the trip. North Beach is great, away from Wharf crowds but a short walk and near the best dining options. Hybrid bus stops right outside the motel. Can walk to cable car, which we did in the early morning to be able to take a ride, it is otherwise very crowded. Quick walk to Alcatraz ferry landing as well. Don't miss Pat's Cafe around the corner, a gem. Such a good value for families!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good people, good location.”
Reviews.Author: sunthorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at columbus motor inn for 3 nights and I have to say we really made the right decision. The room is very clean. The best thing about the hotel is its location. Close to many restaurants. One block away from the famous cable car. Can easily walk to Fisherman's Wharf. We feel very safe even while walking around at late night. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jayjen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3-day visit to SF and stayed at this hotel. We were very impressed! We were able to easily walk everywhere we wanted to go - all the typical tourist stuff plus several wonderful restaurants. We also asked various people at the desk for recommendations and got great tips and advice. The room was small but cozy, clean and updated to my satisfaction. There wasn't a mini fridge or microwave, but that's ok as we'd been looking forward to eating out as much as possible anyway. They did offer a little coffee pot and refills on pods, cream and sugar whenever we asked. There is free parking which I understand to be quite a rare find. I was very impressed with the shower (clean, hot and strong water pressure) and bed (the most comfortable I've found in any hotel thus far!). There was no issue with hallway, neighbor or road noise other than when the street-sweeper went by - very surprising! I was extremely grateful and impressed when I began feeling ill at 2pm on the last day of our stay and decided to head home a day early. Even though it was well past check-out by the time we were packed up and out the door the manager told us there would be no charge for the day. We will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free parking, ideal for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_traveller_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here, for 155 dollar per night excl tax. This is a very basic hotel: just offers room to sleep, and looks kind of old fashioned. The reception is very small (just a very small office in the parking lot) But the rooms are clean and a good size (and if I remember correctly with a big tv), and you have free parking. We did not like the bed very much, but that is a matter of personal preference. At first we were a bit confused when we arrived by car, because we did not see any parking spots available. My husband stayed in the car and I went into the office. We could park in a tiny street next to the hotel. The hotel is very well located: on walking distance of the cable cars (take them early in the morning in you don't like waiting!), Lombard street and Fisherman's wharf,.... From my room, I could see Coit Tower. Maybe with price line or hotwire you can find a fancier hotel for an even better price, but otherwise this hotel is a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you have a car but want to walk around town”
Reviews.Author: TooMuch2Do
Reviews.Content: We were on a college tour road trip and my kids love SF. So we stopped for a night between Stanford and Berkeley. The Columbus Motor Inn was perfect for our needs. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready, but Jennifer let us park the car in the garage (two stories). The hotel office (no lobby) is on the first garage level right off Columbus. But don't let that dissuade you. Our room faced the back so it was very quiet with a view of the Transamerica Pyramid. The room was large with lots of space for four open suitcases, looked like it had been recently redone in neutral colors, and the beds were comfortable. Noah at the office gave great dinner and breakfast recommendations. We easily walked to Ghirardelli Square, to Fisherman's Wharf, and North Beach and back. After dinner, my daughter wanted to see the Golden Gate at sunset. Because of the free parking, we were able to jump in the car, drive to the lot off Marina Blvd., take some pictures, and park back at the hotel in our same spot. In the morning, we were in a hurry, so instead of Pat's he suggested the Columbus Cafe, Columbus and Lombard, for coffee take out, just a couple of blocks away. If you are looking to spend time in a SF hotel room, with views, ambiance, etc., this probably isn't for you. But it's a great location, great staff, safe/clean/spacious, and the free parking can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PA2GA
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 5 European relatives (8 of us in total) and we all found the hotel to be a great choice. Noah couldn't have been more helpful, letting us park our huge rental Sprinter van in front of the hotel because it wouldn't fit in the parking lot. Walk to Pier 39 and other attractions. Try Pat's Cafe for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyCherokee
Reviews.Content: Picked this place due to TripAdvisors reviews. 4 night stay. Great Location, CLEAN, Comfortable bedding. Good Value compared to other Hotels in immediate area - No Charge for Parking (others nearby $25-40 per day). Trolley bus right out front. Desk staff Very HELPFUL especially Noah and Oscar.

Reviews.Title: “Location + Free Parking = Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jotravels2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay with hubby and child. We had a rental car so parking was a consideration when choosing a hotel as was a convenient location since we only had 2 days in SF. This hotel fit the bill. We parked the car for 2 days and never needed it. Very easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli, Pier 39, etc. We also wound up walking to the Ferry Bldg. for the Sat. am Farmer's Market - long walk but great event so if you are there on a Saturday morning and you love food, check it out. Heading in the other direction, very easy to get to North Beach as well. As others mentioned, go to Pat's for a wonderful "California style" breakfast. Overall, good value if you have a car and want easy access to the above mentioned locations...

Reviews.Title: “Best value all round...can't be beaten”
Reviews.Author: Fay2703
Reviews.Content: Being on my own priority was for safety and close to transport, food. Could not have found better value for money, bus outside the door, easy flat walk to Fishermans Wharf, cable cars and resturants. Rooms were very clean, plenty of room and excellent service at front desk. Great views from 3rd floor as well. The only thing that would improve stay would have been breakfast...but obviously that would impact on price so would be a trade off. Go for the bike ride across the Golden Gate to Sausalito...bike shop is only 2 doors down !!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: FuzzyduckUk
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after reading the reviews in Trip Advisor. At first glance, we were a bit worried, but we needn't have. It was clean, with large comfortable rooms. We had the family room, which had a seperate bedroom off the main bedroom. There was everything we needed. The location was great, within walking distance of Fishermans Wharf and all the transport links. The car was safely parked in the carpark, so no worries there. The fabulous Pat's Cafe, was just around the corner where we had fab breakfasts. They also do evening meals on some nights.. Do try it.. the food was fantastic. You won't regret it...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to discover San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Lalaspence
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this little motel for four nights while in San Fran. Must admit, when i saw the website I was a little dubious, but it really does not do this place justice. The reception staff were polite, friendly and very helpful. Offering advice on where to go, what to do and where to eat (Pat's Cafe around the corner serves fantastic breakfasts at a great price!) They also booked our shuttle back to the airport and held onto our bags for us while we mooched around the city on our last day. It is only a 5 min walk to the sea front and very close to fisherman's wharf, there is also a tram and bus line on the doorstep. Also, the free parking is really helpful! The rooms were clean and functional, with coffee facilities, ice machine, wifi, flat screen television, a very useful safe and comfortable beds. The decor is not 'boutique' but that does not matter, it is the perfect base to start exploring this wonderfully diverse city....who cares if it doesn't have twin headed showers and fireplaces for crying out loud! Who goes there to stay in their room all day. I would certainly come back here again and the price is so right....we went out of season and got the rooms at a ridiculously low price. I would recommend this place to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect price, perfect parking, perfectly clean!”
Reviews.Author: jname5
Reviews.Content: What a great location! Within walking distance to restaurants, the cable cars, coffee, Trader Joes and places to sight see! VERY inexpensive but a clean, QUIET, comfortable room. Free parking...come and go as you please. Late at night, they took our keys and parked for us. Employees very pleasant. That's where I will stay when I return!

Reviews.Title: “North beach value!!!”
Reviews.Author: cubuff1453
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and loved everything about it. Given the location, price, and FREE parking you can't match it. That is what makes this place 5 stars. It is not the ritz-carlton by any means, but if you want a clean, comfortable place with excellent location for exploring the best neighborhood of North Beach (in my humble opinion) you can't beat it. You can walk anywhere in North Beach. Fisherman's Wharf is very close and you can grad the trolley to Chinatown and points beyond. We had a view of Coit tower on the 3rd floor with small balcony. Noise was not an issue, plus you are not in your room very often if you are visiting this world class city. Extra tip- Pat's Cafe around the corner is a great spot for breakfast and North Beach Pizza rules.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!!”
Reviews.Author: CAAdams
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on a quick trip through San Francisco. I found it the night before we left using Trip Advisor. It lived up to all the great reviews. Our room was very spacious, clean, and had the nicest TV I have had in a room for a long time. We stayed on the Columbus Street side and were not bothered by noise at all (I am a light sleeper, but never noticed much through the night.) The 2 best things: free parking and with in walking distance to the waterfront. I found hotels that were a little cheaper, but added $35+ a day for parking...yikes. We parked our car and walked everywhere. We also rented bikes from the bike place next door (Blazing Saddles) and spent a full day biking over the GG bridge to Sausilito and back and then all over the downtown area looking at sights. It is a great hotel, we will stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and price”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelKatyTexas
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the great reviews from tripadvisor. We stayed there for 4 nights and the location was great. You could walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, etc. But you are also close to public transportation. You could rent your bike to ride the Golden Gate Bridge right next to hotel. You could hop on a bus right at hotel. You could walk one block and catch a cable car. We needed a car since we were going to Yosemite for 2 days and we didn't have to pay to park the car like many hotels. Our room faced Columbus and we had no problem sleeping at night. It even had a little balcony. The room was updated as other people have said; the website does not do the hotel justice. Extremely affordable and very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Price, and Room”
Reviews.Author: littleheart36
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for four nights (Thur-Sunday). I picked this place due to the reviews. I was a bit leery at first as I did not know the area very well. I wanted something that was clean, close to the wharf/Pier 39, reasonably priced, safe, free parking, and free internet. Well, this hotel fits the bill. The room was super clean and had a very nice large TV on the wall. The hotel is enclosed so the only way anyone can get in is via the lobby elevator/stairs. One of the cable car routes is just around the corner from the hotel on Taylor. Also, the the walk to the wharf is only about 4 blocks down the street(I would recommend going down Taylor as well for this. There is also a great breakfast place, Pat's, on Taylor which is only about a two minute walk from the hotel. This is probably the c losest you can get to the wharf and still stay at a really nice place but not pay an outrageous price. We did not move our car the entire time. You can walk to the wharf/ Pier 39. YOu can take the cable car from the wharf to Union Square and come back again(however it is 5 dollars per person one way but it is a lot of fun and worth the money) Then if you want to go some place else, the bus lines ( which are cheap) are right down the street from the hotel. They have free internet via wire and wireless. I had no problem connecting with my laptop. The front desk staff is super helpful and will be happy to direct you. The only negative thing is that there is not breakfast, no fridge, or microwave,. But, you can request a microwave for 5 dollars per day from what I understand. There is a Safeway, Trader Joes, and Walgreens downt the street. It is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel, maybe even less if you walk fast. OUr room was right over Columbus which is a busy street. But, I had earplugs and did not hear a thing. However, the front desk staff seem very reasonable and would be willing to move you. If you are concerned about street noise, I would ask for a room near the back of the hotel when you make reservations. AND, don't let the BIMBOS sign next to the hotel scare you. This is a nightclub which holds all kids of private parties and events. Althought the name concerend me, I did not witness anything concerning. You can google the name and see fthe place for yourself and upcoming events. . I do have an 11 year old son and was a bit put off by the name, but that was all. . All in all, it is a place I will stay again and would highly recommened it to others. Oh yes, the directions from the hotel site state to turn down Houston once you are on Columbus. I have no idea where this is. Once you turn onto Columbus and see the hotel sign, the garage entrance is right there. Just turn in a find a spot. There are two levels of parking. Another review stated Noah at the front is very nice and helpful and that reviewer was correct. Noah is super nice and very helpful. Hope this review has been useful..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AnkiGeelong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Columbus Motor Inn based on positive trip advisor ratings and were not disappointed. Also the lure of free parking was great as all other motels I had looked at charged at least $20/day. Have stayed in San Fran before at the other end of the Powell St cable car turnaround (Powell Hotel) and thought this place far outrated it. The location is much better. Easy walking to Fishermans Wharf, restaurants, North Beach area, Lombard St. Beautiful neighbourhood. And the price can't be beaten either. Beautiful rooms, nice furnishings, huge flat screen tv, good sized bathroom. Only cons were that the wi-fi in the rooms does not work on ipod touch or iphones - only laptops we were told. And I know that not a lot of motels in the US have them but a mini fridge would have been great (they do have an ice machine). And i think i only noticed it cos the motel we stayed in LA, had both. Otherwise I would not have even thought about it. But nevertheless would not detract me from staying there again. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Comfort”
Reviews.Author: tmb66
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. We enjoyed our 6 night stay at Columbus Motor Inn. Free parking, comfortable bed, extremely clean, friendly staff, affordable comfort in a perfect location to walk to attractions. The Powell Mason cable car is 2 blocks away and the bus stop is right in front of hotel. The in-room high-speed internet worked well and the large flat screen TV is a nice touch. The first night we got a room facing Columbus Ave...the street noise did bother me. The next morning the desk clerk very happily switched us to a room in the rear of the property. Our view overlooked a small alley and onto another building, but there was no street noise at all and we were thrilled with the room. We would have liked a microwave, and I believe you can rent a refrigerator, but other than that I can say nothing bad about Columbus Motor Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Arild
Reviews.Content: The Columbus Motor Inn was spot on for our first visit to San Francisco. The location is perfect, only a short walk away from Fisherman's Wharf and the popular Pier 39. Also note that the cable cars run only two blocks away from the hotel. The check-in and check-out was both quick, and the front desk staff was polite and helpful, but during out trip to other US cities we found more smiling front desk staff. The room was big and for USD 5 extra per night we had a refridgerator in the room. Money well spent, I'll say! Nothing to say about the cleanliness, the room was well cleaned everyday. The only thing about the room was the noise from the street (Columbus), but all in all we really liked the Columbus Motor Inn and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a fantastic location, and a bargain as well!”
Reviews.Author: sleepercar
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights with my partner and my parents; we had a two-bedroom suite. The room was very clean, very quiet, and very comfortable. We didn't have a balcony or a great view (we were facing a back alley), but it was a great place to relax in the evening and lay our heads at night. The location is amazing. It's in the North Beach area of San Francisco, about a 10 minute walk from Pier 39/Fisherman's wharf and just a slightly longer walk to The Embarcadero, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, or Chinatown, depending which way you go. There are nice cafes and restaurants nearby along Columbus street, and easy access to public transit if you wish to go further afield. Don't expect luxury or the most fashionable decor. Do expect friendly service and a clean, quiet, comfortable room, for a great price. We paid about $125/night for a 2-room suite, so about $65 per couple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jenny1964
Reviews.Content: Great Motor Inn, very reasonably priced .Ideally situated for all touristy attractions especially Fisherman's Wharf. Bedroom spacious,clean ,nice decor and comfy beds. A few steps away was Blazing Saddles bike hire for cycling The Golden Gate Bridge .Close to decent eateries. Again ,Pats Cafe did a good choice of reasonably priced breakfasts, lunches and evening meals close by. Hotel reception staff offered local knowledge of eateries etc when asked. Pleasant staff but not in your face type which we liked! Free parking for vehicle was a bonus.Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and well priced”
Reviews.Author: junebug1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great because the parking is free, the rooms are fully equipped and very clean, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and it's right by Fishermans Warf. The rates are pretty good...around 80 on a weekday and 90 on a weekend and the beds are really comfortable as well. When I go back to San Fran, I will most likely stay there again...no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlestonfolks
Reviews.Content: The website for this hotel doesn't do it justice - rooms are all upgraded and refurbished. Extraordinary location! We travel to San Francisco about twice a year and have stayed in several different hotels - this hotel (or one of its' sister properties) will be our home base from now on. Noah at the desk is helpful and hilarious!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,parking ,clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: guildford6
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights in a family suite in december. The location is ideal however sirens and street noise is noticable. There is a laundomat quite close by with an excellent cafe over the road while you are waiting. The rooms were clean and reasonable size. the staff were friendly but not engaging. A request for a bottle opener/corkscrew bought a "it is in use" response.? There is no fridge or microwave. I imagine that this could be a major issue when travelling with a family. It surprises me that they don't put them in when they appear to have a family clientele-similarly a washing machine. We would stay there again for the location, (It was quite safe to walk to north beach for dinner) , the parking and reasonable rates. it was interesting to see what was happening at "Bimbos' nightclub a few doors down each night. I think the location is far better than Lombard/cow hollow area for the average tourist (With or without a car)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, ideal location and free parking!”
Reviews.Author: Kendal321
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad to say about this hotel, we stayed for two nights and it was excellent value, with free parking and internet. Within walking distance of all major places, fisherman's wharf, chinatown, little italy, lombard street, we spent the two days walking everywhere. Rooms were big and spacious, with new massive flatscreen tvs, tea and coffee making facilities. Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, clean, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: cindyandted
Reviews.Content: I requested a room at the end of a hall away from the elevator and not on the street and that's what we got...unfortunately there were three other rooms at the end of this hallway one of which had two screaming/crying children whose father seemed to get the older child all worked up. The noise went on for hours. We requested a room change and got one for the following day (they were booked that night). Even thicker walls couldn't stop the incessant crying. While we were out one of the staff even moved our luggage and other items to the room down the hall. Once we moved we were much happier. The configuration of the room was better and we had a small balcony with a view of Alcatraz and Coit Tower. The street noise was negligible during the night and did not hinder our slumbering. The bed was very comfortable. Large flat screen tv with many channels. The room was clean and the towels good. The housekeepers are friendly and capable. Table and chairs in the room which come in handy if you are getting a pizza or Chinese food delivered. Unfortunately no microwave available for reheating. The desk staff are nice guys but must be engaged a bit if you want info. They did have a bowl of apples one day. All in all CMI is a great deal. Free wifi and ethernet. Reasonably priced. Far away enough from Fisherman's Wharf and chain hotels so that you aren't in the middle of tourist central. Quick walk to FW, North End and Chinatown. Free parking. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mjref
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Columbus. Last year we requested a quiet room months before arriving but were told upon arrival that none was available. So this year I didn't expect to get a quiet room either. However, we did and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was a bit smaller than the ones on Columbus St, but it was more than adequate. The hotel had very few people staying there (until the weekend when it was full); in fact, San Fran was a ghost town compared to our visit exactly one year prior. The bed was very comfortable, the location is perfect and it's well priced. We had a good chat with a cleaning lady who'd been there 30 years. She said the hotel is renovated every 6 years. We ate at McCormick and Kuleto's each night - very good happy hour menu and wonderful clam chowder. Dotties for breakfast downtown was great - big meals and well priced. We bought a 3-day travel pass for $18 each and had got our money's worth on the first day. The Golden Gate bridge is only 30 mins away on the 30 then 28 bus. Riding the cable cars at night is lovely, even in winter. There were no queues at all - again, ghost town! My parents stayed in the same room as us a few weeks later and loved the Columbus. We will stay there if and when we go back to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SpringsTravelers
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, comfortable room; nice staff; great location; and a wonderful value for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & roomy, great location”
Reviews.Author: GBDK
Reviews.Content: A nice clean motel with lots of space. We had a 2 bedroom room. Motel is old but it's nicely done up. A fridge and a 2nd alarm clock is all that we were missing.The beds were comfortable. Great location, a 10 min walk to Fisherman's wharf & Pier 39, and about 30 min walk to union Square. Free parking is a bonus. We felt safe walking around at night. Lots of eateries, convenience stores and launderette all neat by. There was some noise from the street below but it never othered us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value/location!!!”
Reviews.Author: FLadventurers
Reviews.Content: The reviews from tripadvisor are very accurate. Great location within walking distance to Lombard Street, Chinatown. Nice view of the city from our bathroom window and Columbus Ave from the bedroom. Free parking! Spacious rooms. Would stay here again if we could come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - more of a hotel than motel”
Reviews.Author: jdavies2001
Reviews.Content: Not really a motel, this is a hotel with a car park underneath it. Nothing wrong with that though - its in a good location and good value when you compare it to other hotels. Room was clean and large. Staff aren't going to win any customer service awards but they weren't rude. No real personality to the place but nothing to complain about. From the front door you can walk to Fisherman's Wharf in 5mins, tram stop is 2min away and walk into city centre is pleasant, taking about 15-20mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, views and two rooms for the price of one!”
Reviews.Author: vhgusc
Reviews.Content: We had the family suite with two double beds and a separate room with a queen. Spacious with nice views of Coit Tower, the Embarcadero and the bay. We were in the front, so you had to settle into the street noise but the views were worth it. One block off cable car route and a few blocks to Fisherman's Wharf. We loved the location. We would definately stay here again and you can't beat the free parking!

Reviews.Title: “great location/free parking/very clean/great view from third floor corner room”
Reviews.Author: desslock
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for several days in november with wife,2 teenage daughters and a 9 yo daughter. we had the suite with one room with 2 queens and a huge flat screen tv and another room with another queen bed and a flat screen tv. the hotel is not luxurious but is very nice,clean,functional.For some reason all our kids loved the hotel and it was not because of the tvs as we had little time to watch it. From the hotel you can easily walk to ghiradelli square and the wharf . We also walked to the alcatraz ferry pier from the hotel in about 10 minutes. Our family rented bikes to go across GGB from blazing saddles on Hyde st an easy 6-7 walk.There is also a blazing saddles bike shop next to the hotel.We chose the other shop because is closer to the bike path starting point. Around the corner on Taylor street is Pats Cafe which is a cute and tasty place for breakfast. North Beach with all of its food places are just a little longer walk up the street. Golden Boy Pizza has great pizza . From our third floor room we had a great view of Coit Tower lit up at night and from our bed we could see the Alcatraz lighthouse in action at night. We stayed on the streetside away from Bimbos nightclub. yes there is some street noise especially since we stayed there over a weekend but it did not seem to bother anyone. But just in case you can bring earplugs. the front desk was helpful with directions and there is a bowl of apples in the morning.there is a coffee maker in the room. Parking is secure and free. Most hotels in the area charge between 20-50 dollars a night for this parking! Oh yes there is also free wireless internet. Overall a great stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: EFC8
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets high ratings from us for price and convenience. It is located between Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach, very convenient and close to transportation. You can park your car for free and have access to it at any time. We also liked the neighborhood feel of the area, much different from Union Square and all of its chain stores. There are a couple of coffee shops nearby, so it is easy to grab a latte or a quick breakfast before heading out for a day of site seeing. Our only complaint is that it is on a somewhat busy street, so there was quite a bit of street noise, but truthfully after a long day of siteseeing we were so tired at night that it never bothered us. We stayed here because all of the other hotels in more touristy areas were booked, but having stayed there this one time we would definitely say again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Gatorpapa
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. The accomodations were roomy and clean. Location of hotel was perfect for walking to Fisherman's Wharf, Little Italy, Cable Car stops, etc. Parking was secure and FREE!! Flat screen TV, quiet room with balcony. Helpful front desk staff. Safe neighborhood. Without a doubt, would stay at this hotel when in SF in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot but rooms a little dated”
Reviews.Author: Giggida
Reviews.Content: We drove up to San Fran from LA so needed accom with parking. The Columbus is in a great location, close to the wharf, walking distance to Chinatown with some great little cafe's nearby. Bathrooms were a little dated and they don't have an in-room fridge so only provide powdered milk for coffee - yuck. Absolutely HUGE flat screen tv, balcony and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in made up for the the old bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, great view, good location”
Reviews.Author: anfrosen
Reviews.Content: We stepped off the cable car and were in our room in minutes! When the fog lifted, we could not believe the view. This hotel was great for guests with cars. The staff members were all pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great value”
Reviews.Author: maskvg
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious with flat screen tv. The location is minutes from Fisherman's Wharf. I was concerned that the name "Motor Lodge" meant near a bad neighborhood - but the neighborhood was safe. A great value for San Francisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Functional perfection”
Reviews.Author: Citrouille
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, large and spotless room (some with view on Coit Tower and Cable cars), large flat TV, free garage (rare at SF). Nothing superfluous, but all what you need for a good price. For your breakfast: Mama’s is wonderful (on Washington square less than 0.5 mile). Go soon otherwise the queue outside can be long.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service lacking, noisy street traffic.”
Reviews.Author: frodo33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn for only one night, though we did book it originally for 4 nights. We paid $210/night for a spacious room with 2 double beds and one king for our family of 5. The room was quite comfortable but the noise from the traffic kept us up at night. The location otherwise is great with access to transportation and good restaurants without the crowds of people you get at Union Square. The MUNI 30 bus runs by EVERY 15 minutes and it is very loud. The walls are also very thin and we could hear other people. What is really lacking is customer service. We attempted to change rooms because of the traffic noise and was told "I guess you better find another hotel because our last room was booked online". Obviously, our patronage was truly unappreciated. The front desk staff is very monotone and unfriendly which therefore creates an uninviting atmosphere. We ended up going to The Donatello where the customer service was superb. If you decide to stay here, ask for a quiet room in the back away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, safe and clean.”
Reviews.Author: MeggynMurdouch
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have recently returned from a road trip of California. We booked this hotel based or the reviews here and were not disappointed. It is situated in a great location which has easy access to most of the main attractions of San Francisco like Fishermans Wharf, Chinatown, Italian District and Lombard Street is also a couple of blocks walk and well worth a visit! We had a car so the parking was excellent and basically we didnt use the car as walking was only 15 mins to Fishermans Wharf area and there are trams etc which stop in the next street to take you anywhere you want to go. There is a good pub/indian restaurant across the road and lots of laid back bars. Best thing was a small cafe called Pat's Cafe just round the corner which has a great atmosphere and served really good food. We went there several times for breakfast and enjoyed every one. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful and the room cleanliness was great. It has free wifi also so great if you want to do some research while you are there. All in all I would stay here again if going back to San Francisco. it isnt that cheap but I think all things considered it is decent value as San Francisco is not a cheap city to stay in especially if you do not like *roughing it* a bit. I would put this hotel on par with a good 3 star hotel back home.

Reviews.Title: “Wharf Value”
Reviews.Author: dollofvoodoo
Reviews.Content: When I would vacation to San Francisco, I would always stay at Cow Hollow Motor Inn. However, due to the decline in cleanliness and service, I looked elsewhere. Columbus Motor Inn was my choice and I wasn't disappointed. The location is very convenient if you want to visit the Wharf, Ghiradelli's or Alcatraz. All are within walking distance which will save you an incredible amount in parking garage fees. Even though there are two floors of parking, it was rather limited. When I asked the manager about this, he said they generally only run out of parking if there is an event. Should they run out of room, you can double park your car in the lot and they will move it into a spot when one becomes available. Fortunately, I always had a spot. If you need to take a cab, they run very frequently and I never had a problem getting one. The rooms were quite large (even if we didn't get a room with a balcony) and clean. The flat screen TV was nice as well. The mattresses could have been a bit firmer in my opinion, but I like very firm mattresses. They do have wi-fi service, however, I found it to be a bit weak with my iTouch at times. The only real complaint I would have (and it's not the hotel's fault) is there are limited places to eat around the hotel. Nightly fee was about $155 a night but that includes the parking. If you're looking for high scale frills, you won't find it here. But if you're looking for a clean place to stay that almost reminds you of being at home, then I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Columbus Motor Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and safe in Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jsw4773
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel i stayed in on my first trip to the USA and I stayed here due to trip advisor . The best thing was that we felt really safe in a strange city and the location is fantastic - with a 6 year old you need to feel safe. When we woke up at 6 in the morning due to jet lag we walked 2 blocks to the cable car turn on Taylor and got the cable car to Union Square for breakfast - no lines and a really friendly ticket collector. The room was very clean, the staff were friendly enough (although we met better during our trip) and of course the parking was free in a city where you can't park. The hotel was good and I would stay here again because it of the cleanliness, location and the free parking. On the down side it's not cheap (but where is in SF) and the WIFI didn't reach to our room. We stayed in better hotels on our road trip but the location is hard to beat

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortble, and very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: AJH13
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled to SF to visit theTut exhibit and just spend a few days relaxing. Our stay was very comfortable, and we loved the fact that we were walking distance from The Wharf. The Inn provides free parking, which in that area is a great deal. If you want to stay in the area of Fisherman's Wharf. this an ideal place at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & FREE PARKING in the city”
Reviews.Author: roberee
Reviews.Content: Best part is the location. You are within 2 blocks of the cable car line and 5 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. There are a ton of Italian eateries/cafes in the neighborhood (as well as other types of restaurants). A Barnes & Noble and Safeway is within 2 blocks as well. Also, a bike rental place is one block away, so you can rent and ride to wherever your heart desires. The second best thing is the FREE parking. This beats the typical $15-20 daily surcharge other hotels charge. There's complimentary fresh apples on most mornings. The staff is unremarkable but that didn't bother me. The room is good enough. Things were clean. Of course, it's not going to be a brand new place with exquisite furnishings and a plush bed. No. This is a middle of the road hotel. You get what you pay for. It's good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: LeaWisconsin
Reviews.Content: This was a really great place to stay for the price. It was very close to North Beach and many sites were within walking distance. The rooms were nothing fancy but clean and very nice. We had a car and there is of course (since its a motor inn) a garage underneath the hotel which was very convenient for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: grazinggoat66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn in Oct 08 for two nights. For those unfamiliar with San Francisco, it is frightfully expensive for accommodation, so a rate 0f $200 a night for a one bedroom studio was reasonably good value. This allowed my sister and her husband to share the bedroom whilst the nephew and myself had a queen bed each in the lounge area. The rooms were extremely roomy and comfortable....spotless in fact. Along with a dining table big enough for the four of us and flat screen TV's in both rooms, the accommodations were surprisingly good. Another bonus was the fact we were able to park on-site with access to our car anytime day or night (not always possible in San Fran). Fishermans Wharf is at most a 5 minute walk away, and a combination Indian/Chinese restaurant and bar is right across the street. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and recommend it to my fellow Trip Advisor members without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great no-frills place to stay in S.F.”
Reviews.Author: LonghornFreak
Reviews.Content: If you like full service hotels with chatty staffers who will make restaurant recommendations, etc., this is not the place for you. But if you're a budget-minded family who prefers to be left alone to do your own thing, this is the ideal place to stay! Our family (two adults, two teenagers) spent three nights at the Columbus Motor Inn in July. We reserved a two-room suite and requested a refrigerator. The room was spacious and very clean, and having the two TVs was a nice touch. We even had a great view of Coit Tower. We opted not to purchase Muni passes, and instead rode the cable cars or walked everywhere. The hotel is ideally situated and we felt safe walking back there even at night. There are many good restaurants nearby (try Pat's Cafe for breakfast and L'Osteria del Forno in North Beach for dinner) and a Safeway and Trader Joe's within walking distance. We didn't have a car so we didn't take advantage of the free parking, but we rented a car the morning we checked out and it was nice to be able to park it and load our luggage at our leisure. The front desk staff (there really is no "lobby" to speak of) was a bit stonefaced, but we rarely engaged with them anyway. During our entire stay, we rarely saw or heard other guests, even though the place was full. Other than street sounds, it's very quiet. All in all, a terrific place to stay for about $210 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngelaDimit
Reviews.Content: Nice big room, only 2 beds and a bath, clean hotelroom, in a good neighboorhood close to fishermans wharff, little italy and chinatown. Free parking in the garage under the hotel. Nice staff, no breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: SmorkinLabbit
Reviews.Content: The location is great - just a few minutes walk from a cable car station and a little longer to Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms are better than I expected, with a decent amount of space and your own balcony. Unfortunately, the customer service very poor. The front counter is staffed with bored, indifferent, smarmy simps who would sooner spit on you than look at you. Ask a question and prepare to get a smirk and a one-word answer. If you're not out of your room by 9:45am, you can forget maid service. There's no city information (magazines, brochures, etc.) of any kind - not even a phone book. In the end, it's a roof over your head and free parking in a decent area of the city - I still recommend the place, just ignore the staff as they ignore you, expect nothing, and have a great time. Oh, we tried the Indian restaurant across the street as suggested by a previous review - not sure if the management has changed, but the food sucked, and the service was terrible - both the restaurant and the hotel seem to be staffed by zombies who forgot how to smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel in the centre of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: DevonianBusinessman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbus Motor Inn for 3 nights after reading good reviews on tripadvisor and because the parking was free which is a real bonus in San Francisco. Even without sat-nav, we were able to find the motel without any problems - it is located around 10 minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf and around 20 minutes from the Transamerica Pyramid area. The room was large with a seating area by the window and very clean with a really great view of Telegraph Hill and Coit tower. There were ice machines on each floor which was a useful touch if you fancied a glass of wine in your room. This is a motel so there is a very small reception area and no restaurant but this was exactly what we wanted being on a "fly-drive" holiday to California. The parking area is both new and spacious and while this remains a free option then the Columbus Motor Inn will continue to be a highly recommended place to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury but just a brilliant place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: VW2803
Reviews.Content: We asked for and got a 2nd floor room at the rear of the hotel, as recommended by previous reviewer. Room was really big, 2 queen beds and a sofa, everything you could need. Always kept spotlessly clean. We thoroughly enjoyed our 6 nights here and would not hesitate to go back. The location is perfect for walking down to Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars start just around the corner and it's much better cheaper than Marriott or Hilton, which are just around the corner. Not luxury but just a brilliant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in San Fransisco - excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller1950
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip from Australia to Canada and staying in San Fransisco on our way back, I looked at the map for accomodation near the Wharf's. My 1st selection was Columbus Motor Inn and whilst I was a littel bit concerned of booking site unseen, I need not have worried. All my emails with concerns or queries were answered promptly. On arrival we were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was very good and the beds comfortable. The only thing we didn't realise was that a fridge was not in the room realising you can get one for $5 a night towards the end of our stay. Pats cafe was recommended for breakfasts and it was the best place to eat with lovely friendly waiters and Pat was a gem. the Indian Restaurant across the road had lovely food although 1st impression was not too good but once you settled in for the meal, it was great. To be within walking distance of the Pier 39 was very handy and you can get a bus right outside if wanting to go Chinatown or City. thank you for an excellent stay and I highly recommend this accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE, LOCATION & HELPFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: phillygirl55
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old daughter, her best friend & I stayed for 7 nights. It was our first trip to San Francisco and I researched and planned the entire trip before booking. We rented a car for trips to Carmel and other places of interest in the SF area. FREE PARKING was top on my list. I refuse to pay $40 & up to park @ a hotel where I'm a paying guest. The location couldn't have been better. We purchased the Citypass which was also a great value. Noah @ the front desk could not have been more helpful! From restaurant recommendations to driving directions he was WONDERFUL! He should be made manager! WE FELL IN LOVE WITH SAN FRANCISCO. I hope to return to the Columbus Inn soon. I'm just afraid that if word of this little gem gets out, we might not be able to book a room.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: OkstateMom
Reviews.Content: I was SO pleased with this hotel. We loved the cozy, posh atmosphere. My daughter and I were on a trip to the CA coast. This hotel was safe, and very close to everything we wanted to see and do. It had very close access to the Muni to go other places. The gentleman at the desk was very helpful to highlight on a map where we were and how to get where we wanted to go. Parking was free and off of the street. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless !”
Reviews.Author: Twigandbeef
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent 4 days here in June at the end of a 4 week road trip around California. It was just what we needed - a massive, clean , comfortable room, great bed , helpful staff and convenient location. We asked for a room at the back and it was perfectly quiet, which is one thing I was worried about . The desk staff were great, very knowledgeable, patient and kind. Oscar did our on-line flight check-in for us , even though it took him ages to get onto the website. He and all the staff were so friendly and helpful and nothing was any trouble at all. The bus stop was right outside, cable car- stop just one street over and a great Indian restaurant over the road , so everything really convenient. The decision to stay here wasn't taken lightly, as I had read so many reviews for hotels in San Franciso, so we were really pleased at how great it was. I'd have no doubts about staying here next time we are in SF !

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location and GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GwenP
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from vacationing on the west coast. We stayed at the Columbus for one night, and we couldn't have been happier! The location is IDEAL - better than staying at the Warf and at a much better rate. You can not beat the free parking either. You are a couple blocks from the "crookedest street" and Fisherman's Warf. You can grab the cable cars right at the corner or walk two blocks towards FW and grab it at the end/begining of the line. The area is perfectly safe and we never felt nervous while walking around in the evening. One thing to note, however, the nightclub next door is now open again (some people here had previously stated it was closed). We had a room on the third floor on the corner right next to the the club and you could hear the music slightly through the walls. I don't think there would be any problem if you got any of the other rooms facing the street and not the corner room or if you were staying during the week instead of over the weekend like us. Though our room was right in front of the elevators, we never heard a peep from any of the others staying in the hotel. The rooms are VERY clean and nicer then I expected! We loved the layout of the room! Though we didn't have a balcony, we had half a wall of windows that opened and a great little table/chairs to sit and watch the day go by. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom a nice size, and the shower had good water pressure. We would certainly stay here again. The staff was very helpful and polite. NOTE: You may be tempted to ask for a room away from the road, but I wouldn't do so. You're stuck (1) with not view facing the building next door and (2) You're stuck right next to the nightclub - certainly not more quiet then the street during the weekend. The traffic noise was minimal and wouldn't bother the average sleeper. Besides, it's not a huge interstate highway passing by the hotel anyway. Just a regular city street. Fisherman's Warf: This is a very touristy location and not the cute little warf you might imagine or remember from days gone by. Certainly take a stroll down to it to at least check out the sealions basking on the platforms, but I wouldn't recommend eating there unless you just want something basic. Instead, China Town and Little Italy is close by and offers a much better selection and quality of food. Cable Car: Purchase a day pass instead of simply a one-way or round trip ticket. The day pass only costs a couple dollars more and it allows you to jump on and off when you want for the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Average Rooms but Great Location with Parking Included”
Reviews.Author: inneyp
Reviews.Content: The two highlights of this inn are location and parking.
